docs.snippet: The power structure of the Reagan years, and the age of AIDS, gave artists and activists something to rebel against.
docs.abstract: Ginia Bellafante Big City column recounts activism of artists throughout New York City during 1980s, when creative community seemed to be regularly confronting Wall Street greed, neighborhood gentrification, homophobia and AIDS epidemic.

docs.snippet: Photos from Greece, France, Norway and the United States.
docs.abstract: Photos from Greece, France, Norway and the United States.

docs.snippet: The Latest on the arrest of a suspect in the arson of a Florida mosque (all times local):

headline.print_headline: The Latest: Former Inmate: Man Accused of Arson Was Bullied
headline.main: The Latest: Former Inmate: Man Accused of Arson Was Bullied

docs.snippet: Remember that yearly update you used to get from your aunt? Now it’s from your friends and colleagues, every week, and they can see if you’ve read it.

headline.main: What Is a TinyLetter? Like Ye Olde Blog, but Less Public

docs.snippet: Tethered as we are to our smartphones, Samsung asking users of its fire-prone Galaxy Note 7 to "power down and stop using the device" is not just an inconvenience. It's crazy.

headline.print_headline: Samsung Woes Show How Dependent We've Become on Smartphones
headline.main: Samsung Woes Show How Dependent We've Become on Smartphones

docs.snippet: The right-wing opinion and news site championed Donald J. Trump; its chairman, who helped run the campaign, was named chief White House strategist and senior counselor.

headline.print_headline: Breitbart Gains Voice in White House
headline.main: Breitbart, Reveling in Trump’s Election, Gains a Voice in His White House

docs.abstract: Pres-elect Donald J Trump appoints Breitbart News chairman Stephen K Bannon as his chief White House strategist and senior counselor; critics say appointment will allow Breitbart, who has huge social media influence, to play unprecedented role in modern presidency.

docs.snippet: Justyna Mielnikiewicz, who taught herself photography by studying the legendary photo essays of W. Eugene Smith, won the Smith Fund’s 2016 grant in humanistic photography.
docs.abstract: Justyna Mielnikiewicz, who taught herself photography by studying the legendary photo essays of W. Eugene Smith, won the Smith Fund’s 2016 grant in humanistic photography.

docs.snippet: Friday: Registering for elections, a Dog Film Festival, and brass bands taking to the streets.

headline.main: New York Today: Final Call for Voters

docs.snippet: A documentary maker who was filming as environmental protesters attempted to shut down the flow of oil through pipelines carrying crude from Canada to the United States was arrested and her footage confiscated, activists said on Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: Documentary Filmmaker Arrested at Canada-U.S. Pipeline Protest
headline.main: Documentary Filmmaker Arrested at Canada-U.S. Pipeline Protest

docs.snippet: The president-elect spoke by phone with the president of Taiwan in the first such contact since the United States severed diplomatic relations with the island.

headline.print_headline: Trump Muddies China Relations With Taiwan Call
headline.main: Trump Speaks With Taiwan’s Leader, an Affront to China
